topic.title: Packet Payload Patterns

body.p: The packet payload patterns include one 128-byte fixed pattern and three 32-byte fixed patterns that are globally configured with specific packet contents or arbitrary patterns. For each packet one of the four fixed pattern sources is selected according to the indication in the packet descriptor and forms the payload at the start of the packet. After the fixed pattern, the rest of the payload to make up the packet length is filled with random data. The payload in the packets is not checked at the downstream monitor as the monitor only checks the FCS calculated over the selected payload.
